definition: to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
dry/clean/in vain/dried food/foster/adoptive/to ignore
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven/male principle/☰/ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)
surname Gan
surname Qian
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Lee said he was most obedient to his parents, then, he was a hollow laugh.
sentences.chinese: 李說他最聽爸媽的話，任乾笑了。

sentences.english: He forced a laugh to his shaking lips.
sentences.chinese: 他顫抖的兩脣發出了一聲乾笑。

sentences.english: He gave a dry laugh, then sat down and started on the pastries.
sentences.chinese: 杜新籜說着乾笑一聲，坐下去就喫點心。

sentences.english: As she parted her lips in a mirthless smile, her even white teeth were bared as if ready to bite.
sentences.chinese: 她露出她的白牙齒乾笑，那整齊的牙齒好像會咬人。

sentences.english: Jack snickered nervously and leaned back in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 傑克緊張地乾笑了一聲，仰身靠在椅背上。

shy/bashful
interjection of pain or surprise/also written 哎喲|哎哟

see 惱羞成怒|恼羞成怒[nao3 xiu1 cheng2 nu4]
face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
to follow after/immediately afterwards
posthumous/one's social background/behind the body
variant of 怎麼|怎么[zen3 me5]
straightforward/clear-cut/blunt (e.g. statement)/you might as well/simply
from now on/in the future/time to come
achoo (phonetic particle for sneeze)
euphoria/transport/bliss
to recoil/to draw back/to fall back/to retreat
dry/parched/dull/insipid
